description: Frequency sweep configuration for guane15 (Xeon E5645 - Westmere, pcc-cpufreq driver)

benchmarks.name: gpu_gemm_naive
benchmarks.description: GPU GEMM naive implementation (M K N iterations)

benchmarks.name: gpu_gemm_google
benchmarks.description: GPU GEMM with Google Benchmark (requires compilation with Google Benchmark)

notes: Adapted for guane15.uis.edu.co: Xeon E5645 (Westmere, 2010) with 8x Tesla M2075 (Fermi GF110). CPU: pcc-cpufreq driver, 1.6-2.4 GHz. GPU: Base 575 MHz, typical range 405-700 MHz. Benchmarks: CPU (dot, memcpy from benchmarks/cpu/), GPU (GEMM from gpu_benchmark/, stencil from benchmarks/gpu/). 5 CPU × 5 GPU × 5 benchmarks × 5 sizes × 5 reps = 3125 experiments. IMPORTANT: 1) Compile CPU benchmarks (gcc), 2) Build gpu_benchmark (cmake/nvcc), 3) Verify GPU frequency support with 'nvidia-smi -q -d SUPPORTED_CLOCKS', 4) Run test_sweep_guane15.json first to validate setup.
